failure_modes: Wrong fraction in receiver (premature or late cut)

detection.what_operator_sees: Liquid rising in neck, foam at surface, sudden level change in receiver

PHASE_ORDERING.pelican_specificity: Elevated vs open distillation because sealed circulation creates additional phase-ordering failure points (liquid return, multiple phase boundaries).

detection.what_operator_sees: Smell change in distillate, cloudiness in receiver, unexpected color
detection.detection_difficulty: MODERATE (requires trained nose, not always immediate)
detection.response_time_required: MODERATE (tens of seconds, but damage may already be done)

COMPOSITION_JUMP.pelican_specificity: Similar to open distillation. Pelican reflux does not significantly change composition jump risk compared to simple alembic.

failure_modes: Overpressure burst (sealed vessel exceeds pressure tolerance)
Thermal shock crack (temperature differential breaks glass)

detection.what_operator_sees: Unusual sounds (hissing, popping), vessel vibration, visible leak at joints
detection.detection_difficulty: MODERATE (auditory cues may be subtle before catastrophe)

CONTAINMENT_TIMING.pelican_specificity: STRONGLY ELEVATED vs open distillation. Open alembic has ~5-10% containment risk. Pelican sealed system elevates this to ~24% because pressure is trapped. This is the KEY DISCRIMINATOR for pelican vs open distillation.

failure_modes: Flow imbalance (reflux return rate vs distillation rate mismatch)
Flooding (vapor cannot rise through descending liquid)

detection.what_operator_sees: Uneven flow in return path, gurgling sounds, liquid accumulation

RATE_MISMATCH.pelican_specificity: Low rate mismatch is consistent with pelican (simple single-loop circulation) rather than column distillation (multiple rate-sensitive stages).

detection.what_operator_sees: Burning smell, discoloration of residue, smoke
detection.detection_difficulty: EASY (unmistakable smell, but damage already done)
detection.response_time_required: PREVENTION (by the time you smell burning, product is lost)

ENERGY_OVERSHOOT.pelican_specificity: Similar across distillation types. Energy overshoot risk is independent of vessel topology (open vs sealed).

pelican_specificity.containment_note: CONTAINMENT_TIMING at 24% is consistent with sealed pelican vessel (expected ~25% for sealed vs ~5% for open). This is the strongest apparatus-type signal.
pelican_specificity.rate_note: RATE_MISMATCH at 6% is consistent with simple single-loop apparatus (pelican) rather than complex multi-stage column still.

explanation: Rank correlation with pelican expected: rho=0.900 (vs open alembic: rho=0.600). 5/5 classes phenomenologically coherent. CONTAINMENT_TIMING at 24% confirms sealed-vessel apparatus. Hazard distribution matches pelican reflux distillation failure mode frequencies.
